name: The Westin Key West Resort & Marina

reviews.text: Overall I think this is a great hotel for the location alone. It's right next to Mallory Square and Duvall street! We were able to see the sunset from our oceanfront room and restaurants were within walking distance, which was wonderful! Two cons - first, we had an oceanfront room and woke up the first morning to a huge cruise ship blocking our ocean view. The second is my BF is Starwood preferred and usually there's a welcome gift.. This hotel did not treat is any differently from anyone else. Given how much business we give them, we were disappointed.
reviews.title: Oceanfront blocked by cruise ships :(

reviews.text: Overall I'd stay again but wouldn't pay extra for the oceanfront room!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location for all to do in Key West. Staff was top notch. Shannon at the front desk took especially good care of us. Kenai at the Bistro 245 was as good a server as you could find anywhere. I recommend everyone stay at this hotel if you have the opportunity. Rick
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at most of the hotels near Mallory Square in Key West, but not at the Westin, so we decided to give it a try. Of course the location is wonderful, and being a bit off Mallory Square is actually a plus.
reviews.title: Overall excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was lovely. If you stand where the cruise ships dock and look at the corner of the hotel where the gazebo-like balconies are, that's where our suite was. On the top floor. Not only did it have a large living area and separate bedroom (each with its own balcony), there were two full baths, a wet bar with refrigerator, a small dining area, two TVs, and comfortable furniture both inside and out. You could really have a nice party there.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at many Westin Hotels, unfortunately this one was forgettable. I had arranged for a room with a partial ocean view. What I received was a view that was obstructed by an elevated bar and daily cruise ships at the dock. They could not move me to a different room.
reviews.title: Keep Looking

reviews.text: For three of the seven days we were there they were performing maintenance to the metal shutters for some of the rooms that surround the pool. All day long there was drilling and screwing or these metal shutters some 15 feet from the pool. It was impossible to relax. I brought this to the attention of management and they offered me a breakfast coupon.
reviews.title: Loved the pool area!!

reviews.text: Do your self a favor and avoid this property!
reviews.title: The view is hard to beat

reviews.text: Very clean hotel, close to the main strip, Duvall St. We sat by the poolside for an afternoon and it was so relaxing. Although there were lots of ppl in the area it was very quiet. Server came around with fruit for everyone. Best piña colada that I have had!!
reviews.title: Nice place for a drink @ mallory square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the chance to stay at this westin after years of walking by it on the boardwalk that leads to the sunset celebration on mallory square..there is simply no better location to watch sunset from your room..the rooms have wonderful beds and are nicely appointed but they lack some of the modern technology tie ins that hotels in this oricerange comonly offer...ie a audio system to plug in my pandora...a sd slot on the flat screen to look at pics ...the food at the hotel was unremarkable and overpriced..the drinks were okay ..but the service was very cool and un key westy..over all for the money..they need to step it up..the bell staff/valets are extremely helpful in getting cabs and directions...note ..the cruise ship pirt is directly in front of the hotel ..so when they are in port there is no view and thousands of travelers surrounding and walking thriugh the resort
reviews.title: Fantastic Key West Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in early February. We thought it was just about the best location in town. If you get one of the trolley tickets that is good for 2 days you can get pretty much anywhere you want to go on the island, and if you buy tickets to things like Hemingway House or the Winter White House at the same time you get an attraction discount. The hotel is fine. We were in the building which is not attached to the main building where you check in. Staff was nice. Can't remember the room # but it was quite a hike to and from the elevator. Not a problem for us but might be troublesome for anyone with mobility issues. They have an outside bar where you can get a drink in the afternoon or early evening but it was open for only very limited hours. Room itself fine, clean and yes, you will have your view blocked by cruise ships during the day. They leave around 5:00. No complaints although many people might prefer the atmosphere of the smaller guest house type places. I will say that when I was in Key West 30 years ago the town was much more of a unique experience than it is today. Just my opinion.
reviews.title: Great Location, No Problems
Average accommodations
reviews.text: My family and I were recently in key west. This was our first visit. The area is interesting with a lot of things to keep the average person busy. The major surprise to my wife and I was the cruise ships. We had a ocean view the night we arrived, and by morning we were looking at a 20 story Carnival Cruise liner. Surprise! Besides the obstructed view, now 3,000 plus are flocking to Duval street. Sure the ship leaves around 5pm, but the next morning it's ground hog day all over.
The hotel was average, the people including the manager are very nice, and they try hard to make your stay accommodating.
reviews.title: Excellent views when available

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, and has a nice hot tub and pool. The rooms are average and probably would only come up to 3 star standards.
reviews.title: Great location. Fabulous views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can now say I've been to key west. Can't say that I would be looking to go back anytime soon!
reviews.title: Wonderful location, wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Upon arrival we drove around the block doir times trying to figure out where to pull in, poor signage! Checked in late last night, got to our room, then out to get something to eat. Now in the light of day nothing at all special about the place. Water pressure is TERRIBLE! While using the blow dryer it fell apart in my hands. I understand things get used a lot. No problem other than I could have shocked myself on the exposed wires. We went about our day returning to our room to find the still broken blow dryer right where I left it! I know it's small, but the little things do make a difference. Keep looking I know you can find a better place for less. We felt like they had us based on location alone. I will not stay here again, probably not at a Westin.
reviews.title: Nothing special other then location considering the price. Keep looking.

reviews.text: Weston's "Sunset Celebration" cafe/restaurant/bar on the rail wharf side is an excellent spot for sunset viewing, and features delicious food and service. The brief menu can be augmented with wider selection if you ask for the main restaurant menu.
reviews.title: Sunset Celebration restaurant on the wharf - great spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin is a nice hotel in an ideal location. I travel for leisure using frequent stay points I earned on business trips, so have tried the Crowne Plaza and the Hyatt in Key West as well. The Westin is better, in my opinion. This time, I was assigned a very nice pool view room, right on the ground floor overlooking some greenery. It was nice to sit out there sipping coffee in the morning and cocktails in the evening. Food and beverage service pool-side was superb. The food itself was much better than I expected it to be. Having access to the sunset fun of Mallory Square right outside my door was excellent. Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The only complaint I have is that on the last day, although I had requested and received a late check-out, the maid apparently did not get that information and knocked on the door several times even though I had a "do not disturb" sign on the door. Although she was just doing her job, and was probably under some pressure to get the vacated rooms cleaned and ready for the new arrivals, it was not exactly the quiet rest and recovery time I had hoped to have with the late check-out. In no way would that impact my desire to stay at the Westin again, but I do think I would ask the front desk to notify the cleaning staff if I request a late check-out again.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.text: We just spent 3 lovely nights at the KEy West Westin. Rooms were a little on the small side, but who cares when it is so beautiful outside. The hotel is right on the water next to Mallory Square and the sunsets are fabulous to view. Splurge and get a waterside room. It is worth it. Cruise shops dock there during the day, but must leave before sunset. The restaurant on the property "245" is fabulous!!! The other restaurant, "Latitude" on Sunset Key, a short boat ride, is highly over rated in our opinion. Our food there was a much lower quality and over-cooked compared to 245, which is less pricey. Service was not good and mistakes were on our bill.
reviews.title: Hotel and Restaurants Review

reviews.text: Christy was our waitress on 2-13 as we watched the sunset and had snacks and drinks. She was friendly, accommodating and informative about Key West. She was very helpful and pleasant and we really have fond memories of the Westin as a result. Ask for her if you go to watch the sunset or any other time. She is the best!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful waitress at the bar outside.

aka: The Westin Key West Resort & Marina Hotel
description: The Westin Key West Resort & Marina is located in Old Town Key West right on the waterfront with one of the country’s largest private ports which welcomes cruise ships from around the world.
